description: From Latin dijudico (“I dijudicate”); di- (a combining form of dis-) + judico (“I judge”).

verbs.description: dijudicate (third-person singular simple present dijudicates, present participle dijudicating, simple past and past participle dijudicated)

entries.meaning: To make a judicial decision; to decide; to determine.
examples: The Church of Rome, when ſhe commends unto us the Authority of the Church in dijudicating of Scriptures , ſeems only to ſpeak of her ſelf
